title: How prevalent were Greeks in Roman Anatolia? - Quora

response.answer_text: Anatolia? Who do you think named it such? Anatoli in Greek means EAST. The Greeks named it so. How prevalent were the Greeks in Roman Anatolia? Very. The Greeks started migrating to Anatolia around 2500 B C. The Roman empire didn’t even exist then. When Alexander crossed into the Hellespont, Greeks were already there to meet him. How did you think he moved so quickly and had support? Fewer skirmishes.
